meanings.sent1: The knars of the car brakes made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent2: The old door hinges let out a loud knars when opened.
meanings.sent3: The knars of the chalk on the blackboard echoed through the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The knars of the rusty gate sounded like a chorus of angry birds.
meanings.sent5: The knars of the violin strings created a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The branches knars against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The old chair knars every time someone sits on it.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to knars its way out of the closed door.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the machine knars as they struggle to turn.
meanings.sent5: The wheels of the cart knars as it rolls over the uneven ground.

meanings.definition: A knot or gnarl in wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter smoothed out the knars in the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: The knars in the tree trunk added character to the sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The knars in the floorboards made it difficult to walk smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The knars in the log resembled faces when seen up close.
meanings.sent5: The knars in the fence posts showed the age of the wood.
